discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Would C "compatibility" not be the most important what do you do if you coped everything over but some features don't work anymore, then after that network utilization followed by I/O of storage, as I/O means nothing in the cloud if the network is slower than the I/O.

Selected Answer: C
Obviusly answer is C.

questions.question_text:
A company is switching from one cloud provider to another and needs to complete the migration as quickly as possible.
Which of the following is the MOST important consideration to ensure a seamless migration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
LDAP is for Active Directory...
WAF windows application firewall
VDI - virtual desktop interface

The right solution is only SSO Single Sign-On!

Selected Answer: D
Its D, they're looking for seamless experience when using the collaboration service SSO "Single Sign On" will accomplish this the others wont

questions.question_text:
A company recently subscribed to a SaaS collaboration service for its business users. The company also has an on-premises collaboration solution and would like users to have a seamless experience regardless of the collaboration solution being used.
Which of the following should the administrator implement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
an old TLS certificate, so please, the right answer is only only only D!

" only internal users who are using new versions of the OSs are able to load the application home page."

Answer is D.
I think the correct is C.

choices.B: The local firewall from older OSs is not allowing inbound connections
choices.A: The local firewall from older OSs is not allowing outbound connections
choices.D: The cloud web server is using strong ciphers that are not supported by older browsers
choices.C: The cloud web server is using a self-signed certificate that is not supported by older browsers

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator has migrated an internal application to a public cloud. The new web server is running under a TLS connection and has the same TLS certificate as the internal application that is deployed. However, the IT department reports that only internal users who are using new versions of the OSs are able to load the application home page.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
furthest -> Long Term Support (OS).
The answer is B.

What is an LTS OS?
Long-term support (LTS) is a product lifecycle management policy in which a stable release of computer software is maintained for a longer period of time than the standard edition.
I think the Correct is B: LTS - Long-Time Support

questions.question_text:
A systems administrator is provisioning VMs in a cloud environment and has been told to select an OS build with the furthest end-of-life date.
Which of the following OS builds would be BEST for the systems administrator to use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The issue with resource allocation refers to the improper granting of permissions or access rights to specific users, groups, or roles within a system or application.

In the described context, the problem with resource allocation is highlighted by the fact that members of the sales team have gained access to the financial application, despite not being authorized to do so. This problem may stem from improperly configured permissions within the cloud environment.

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is reviewing the authentication and authorization mechanism implemented within the cloud environment. Upon review, the administrator discovers the sales group is part of the finance group, and the sales team members can access the financial application. Single sign-on is also implemented, which makes access much easier.
Which of the following access control rules should be changed?
